title: Pomar Junction 2016 Viognier (El Pomar District)
description: Fairly reserved on the nose, this bottling offers Condrieu-esque aromas of honeydew candy and creamy tropical fruits without going overripe. There's a citrusy, Key lime freshness at the tip of the sip, and then come more plush flavors of nectarine in the midpalate, finishing with a creamy texture.

title: Rough Day 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Thracian Valley)
description: Garnet in the glass with aromas of blueberry preserves, red raspberries and cherry cola, this Bulgarian Cabernet Sauvignon has soft tannins and a balanced palate that lingers with flavors of black cherry and plums.

title: Stella Bella 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Margaret River)
description: Shy at first, this Margaret River Cab reveals a lot after some swirling in glass: plush cherry and raspberry fruit, mint, dark chocolate and a slightly herbal, earthy core. Tart cherry notes continue on the medium-bodied palate, with tannins that are tightly wound but elegant. This is drinkable now with some time in decanter but will best express itself with over the next few years.

title: Streicker 2012 Bridgeland Block Syrah (Margaret River)
description: Bigger and richer than some of its Western Australian counterparts, this Shiraz has some age on it and is showing it with notes of raw meat, Dr. Pepper, red currant and earthy funk. There's still plenty of big, oaky tannins but the acidity is well balanced. There's still several more years of life here. Drink now–2023.

title: Thomas Schmitt 2016 Private Collection Estate Bottled Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Traces of apple blossom and lemon are subdued on the nose but turn riper and richer on the palate, melding into lush yellow peach and tangerine. Off dry and spry, it's a zesty, fruity wine with wide appeal. Drink now through 2019.

title: Troon 2016 Grenache (Rogue Valley)
description: Despite its potent alcohol, this is an elegant wine with pretty raspberry and strawberry fruit. It's lightly dusted with cinnamon notes and is fresh and lively in the mouth. Enjoy over the next couple of years.

title: Vidon Vineyard 2015 Saturn Syrah (Chehalem Mountains)
description: In classic Rhône fashion, this was co-fermented with 3% Viognier. It's slightly thin for Syrah, which enjoys considerable success in both Southern Oregon and Rocks District AVAs. Black cherry fruit and a streak of coffee capture the varietal stamp, and moderate alcohol makes this a good choice for mealtime.

title: Villa Wolf 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Pfalz)
description: Crisp peach and tangerine tones are thirst quenching in this easygoing Sauvignon Blanc. While not a deeply complex or concentrated wine, it's nuanced by hints of grass and spice. The finish is brisk but clean. Drink now.

title: Viñalba 2014 Gran Reserva Malbec (Valle de Uco)
description: Desiccated dark fruit aromas recalling prune, raisin and cassis open this lush and chewy Malbec. Heady flavors of smoky blackberry and cassis lead into a raisiny finish with chocolate cake notes. This falls just short due to weight and balance issues.

title: Banrock Station 2015 Merlot (South Eastern Australia)
description: Pretty red fruit and herbs are backed by a little earthy, stalky notes. The palate is a little on the tart side, but it's also juicy and easygoing, with soft tannins and a light to medium body.

title: Battle Creek 2014 Yamhela Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This wine's aromas aren't quite ready to reveal their charms, its spice, red fruit and tangerine peel notes locked up for now. It's full and weighty, with flavors that seem muddy on the midpalate but come together on the finish.

title: Benedek 2015 Hárslevelü (Mátra)
description: Aromas of vanilla ice cream, white peach and pear juice lead into flavors of peach, pear and Mediterranean herbs on the palate. It is pleasantly astringent with a savory finish.

title: Binz 2016 Nackenheimer Kabinett Trocken Pinot Gris (Rheinhessen)
description: Sunny tangerine and apricot flavors are pert and fresh in this dry Pinot Gris that offers a rich, rounded body. Moderately concentrated, with fresh citrus acidity, it's a satisfying and approachable white for everyday. Drink now through 2020.

title: Bodegas Eidosela 2016 Ethereo Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Apple and leesy aromas are largely fresh and textbook for the variety. A plump, slightly oily palate features just enough acidity, while peachy flavors of nectarine flatten out on the finish. Drink now.

title: Briceland 2014 Ronda's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Humboldt County)
description: This lively, rather lean wine has enticing spicy aromas and exotic fruit flavors on a frame of good acidity and firm tannins. Light touches of spicy oak add some complexity, and the texture is robust enough to pair with very rich proteins.

title: Annabella 2014 Special Selection Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This is a hearty, full-bodied wine with some age on it. It is robust in a popular style that offers bold layers of anise, baked peach and pineapple.

title: Argento 2015 Bonarda (Mendoza)
description: This Bonarda is carried by grapey and jammy blackberry aromas. It's a bit high-toned on the palate, but food will calm things down. Prune and baked blackberry flavors carry into the finish, along with a green note.

title: Barton 2015 Forever Young Vogelzang Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Aromas of lemon rind, pink grapefruit skins and apple flesh are somewhat reserved on the nose of this bottling. The palate shows apple rinds, seared nectarine, guava skins, lemongrass and a strong cut-grass flavor.

title: Battle Creek 2014 Battle Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This wine's stem, ash and herb aromas are at the fore, needing more time in bottle to settle. The palate is light on its feet, with interesting grapefruit accents. It comes up a bit short on the finish.

title: Domaine Loubejac 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Though the name and label suggest a French take on Oregon Pinot Noir, this wine's flavors have more in common with inexpensive California versions. Its jammy, forward and ripe strawberry fruit is hard to resist at this price. Drink it up while it remains young and fresh.

title: Eola Hills 2015 Tempranillo (Oregon)
description: Sourced from the Umpqua Valley, where the Oregon Tempranillo renaissance is headquartered, this plum- and cherry-flavored red has the forward, light fruit flavors of grapes from young vines. The tannins are ripe and balanced and the finish just a bit astringent.

title: Ferrari-Carano 2015 Emilia's Cuvée Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Perfumed in apple and orange blossom aromas, this is a robust, fleshy wine that leans into an intensity of apple, melon and pineapple flavor, finishing focused and steeped in oak.

title: Finca Las Moras 2013 Mora Negra Malbec Blend (Pedernal Valley)
description: A smooth nose with ripe berry aromas is a nice opening to this Malbec-Bonarda blend. In the mouth, it's austere, with high acidity and grating tannins. It has nice plum and blackberry flavors, but textural choppiness dominates its dry finish.

title: Frank Family 2014 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: Brambly blackberry, black cherry and black coffee intermingle in this full-bodied richly ripe and robust red. Thick in tannin and oak, the fruit finds its balance and has its day.

title: Franz Keller 2016 vom Löss Pinot Blanc (Baden)
description: Plumes of blossom and stone fruit on the nose turn quieter on the palate of this dry, slightly demure Pinot Blanc. Crisp lime, lemon and apple tones are refreshing. The finish reverberates with bitter lime pith and crushed mineral notes. Drink now through 2019.

title: Gen Del Alma 2014 Gene Fuerza Tranquila Red (Tupungato)
description: Grapey black fruit aromas come with notes of clay and violets in this Malbec blend. On the palate, strong acid and tannins form a barrier wall. Its high-toned plum, currant and wild berry flavors come with gritty tannins that persist on the finish. With food, especially Argentinian asado, this won't go wrong.

title: Goodfellow 2015 Heritage No. 6 Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Part of a new reserve-level series from single vineyard blocks, this wine was made from 100% Fir Crest Vineyard fruit that was fermented using 75% whole clusters and aged in 50% new oak. Despite all the care and attention, it shows little besides very tart raspberry fruit and a high-acid finish.

title: Goodfellow 2015 Richard's Cuvée Whistling Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Ribbon Ridge)
description: This reserve-level cuvée spent 21 months in 50% new French oak, but it's the acids that dominate the palate. Lemony tart, it has enough concentration to pair well with light seafoods.

title: Heinz Eifel 2016 Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Pink grapefruit and passion fruit are plush and ripe in this fruity quaffer. Balanced sweetness and sunny acidity amplify its easy drinking appeal. Drink now through 2019.

title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2015  Marsannay
description: This crisp, cherry-perfumed wine offers attractive acidity as well as bright red-currant and red-berry flavors. The core of tannins will allow it to age well over the next few years. Drink from 2019.
